title-group.article-title: "The Second Saddest Story: Despair, Belief, and Moral Perseverance in Penelope Fitzgerald's The Bookshop"

permissions.copyright-statement: Copyright Â© 2012 JNT: Journal of Narrative Theory

ref.mixed-citation: Julia Kristeva: "Values do not hold in the face of that 'irony of the community' (as Hegel called women), whose destructiveness, however, is not necessarily amusing" (257).
Katherine A. Powers, the Boston Globe's book critic, called it "one of the 10 best nov- els I have ever read in my life."
